Generation IV.Diamond: Its colors and shapes differ from region to region. In the Sinnoh region, two types are confirmed.
Generation IV.Pearl: It lives along bodies of water. Its body shape has changed to suit its habitat.
Generation IV.Platinum: Beware of pushing strongly on its squishy body, as it makes a mysterious purple fluid ooze out.
Generation IV.HeartGold: Its shape and coloration vary, depending on its habitat.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Its shape and coloration vary, depending on its habitat.

Generation V.Black: Beware of pushing strongly on its squishy body, as it makes a mysterious purple fluid ooze out.
Generation V.White: Beware of pushing strongly on its squishy body, as it makes a mysterious purple fluid ooze out.
Generation V.Black 2: Beware of pushing strongly on its squishy body, as it makes a mysterious purple fluid ooze out.
Generation V.White 2: Beware of pushing strongly on its squishy body, as it makes a mysterious purple fluid ooze out.

Generation VI.X: Beware of pushing strongly on its squishy body, as it makes a mysterious purple fluid ooze out.
Generation VI.Y: Its shape and coloration vary, depending on its habitat.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Beware of pushing strongly on its squishy body, as it makes a mysterious purple fluid ooze out.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Its shape and coloration vary, depending on its habitat.

Generation VII.Sun: Shellos lives in the sea and feasts on plankton. The lovelier the ocean where Shellos resides, the more vibrant its color becomes.
Generation VII.Moon: The difference in color from one Shellos to another seems to be a result of their diet. No large changes can be seen in their capabilities.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: When it senses danger, it gushes a purple liquid. Some theories suggest this liquid is a greasy sweat induced by stress.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Scientists interested in its great regenerative capabilities are currently analyzing the materials from which its cells are made.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Its colors and shapes differ from region to region. In the Sinnoh region, two types are confirmed.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It lives along bodies of water. Its body shape changed to suit its habitat.
Generation VIII.Sword: There's speculation that its appearance is determined by what it eats, but the truth remains elusive.
Generation VIII.Shield: Its appearance changes depending on the environment. One theory suggests that living in cold seas causes Shellos to take on this form.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Found in abundance on seashores bordering cold waters. When pressed upon, the Pokémon will secrete from its body's surface a purple fluid that will stain one's clothes.

Generation IX.Scarlet: A recently published research paper states that this form of Shellos is gradually decreasing in number.
Generation IX.Violet: This Pokémon can often be seen along seashores. It's capable of spending a limited amount of time on land.
